intro: Chorisanthera, commonly known as the flame flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, South America, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its showy, brightly colored flowers that often resemble flames, hence its common name. Chorisanthera species typically have palmate leaves and produce capsules as fruits. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
